p: In order to get further understanding of the key pathway in the ingredient-target-pathway network, the nodes associated with neuroactive ligand-receptor interaction were extracted and reorganized as a core subnetwork (Fig. 4), which contained 8 ingredients, 50 proteins and 150 connections. Degree values of the network were also evaluated as mentioned above. Interestingly, eugenol ( k = 47) and geraniol ( k = 46) were also key nodes with much higher degree values, whereas ⟨ k⟩ of the network was only 5.08. This result supported the importance of eugenol and geraniol for O. fragrans var. thunbergii essential oil.
